hard_x_rays.channel.documentation: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera)

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].centr.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].geome.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].outli.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system
Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].radiu.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2
Index in the error_description list for "radius"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].surfa.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data
Index in the error_description list for "surface"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x1_un.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is horizontal and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x1_wi.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x2_un.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x2_wi.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x3_un.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.p.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.r.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.z.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.geometry.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.outline..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.radius_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.surface_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "surface"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x1_unit_.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is horizontal and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x2_unit_.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x3_unit_.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band.documentation: Set of energy bands in which photons are counted by the detector

hard_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].de.documentation: Probability of detection of a photon impacting the detector as a function of its energy
Index in the error_description list for "detection_efficiency"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].en.documentation: Array of discrete energy values inside the band
Index in the error_description list for "energies"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].lo.documentation: Lower bound of the energy band
Index in the error_description list for "lower_bound"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].up.documentation: Upper bound of the energy band
Index in the error_description list for "upper_bound"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].etendue.documentation: Etendue (geometric extent) of the channel's optical system

hard_x_rays.channel[:].etendue_error_ind.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "etendue"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].etendue_method.documentation: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods

hard_x_rays.channel[:].etendue_method.in.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

hard_x_rays.channel[:].line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points

hard_x_rays.channel[:].line_of_sight.fir.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].line_of_sight.sec.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].radiance.documentation: Photons received by the detector per unit time, per unit solid angle and per unit area (i.e. photon flux divided by the etendue), in multiple energy bands if available from the detector

hard_x_rays.channel[:].radiance.data_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

hard_x_rays.channel[:].radiance.validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

hard_x_rays.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

hard_x_rays.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

hard_x_rays.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d.documentation: Emissivity profile per energy band (assumed common to all channels used in the profile reconstruction)

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d[:].emi.documentation: Radial profile of the plasma emissivity in this energy band
Index in the error_description list for "emissivity"

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d[:].hal.documentation: External (towards separatrix) half width of the emissivity peak (in normalised toroidal flux)
Index in the error_description list for "half_width_external"
Internal (towards magnetic axis) half width of the emissivity peak (in normalised toroidal flux)
Index in the error_description list for "half_width_internal"

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d[:].low.documentation: Lower bound of the energy band
Index in the error_description list for "lower_bound"

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d[:].pea.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate position at which the emissivity peaks
Index in the error_description list for "peak_position"

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d[:].rho.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor_norm"

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d[:].upp.documentation: Upper bound of the energy band
Index in the error_description list for "upper_bound"

hard_x_rays.emissivity_profile_1d[:].val.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the emissivity profile data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.homogeneous_t.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.version_put.a.documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS

hard_x_rays.ids_properties.version_put.d.documentation: Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS
